page.title: 05GEOLOGY-THE BOURNE VALLEY
page.content: The area is mostly hilly but with two beautiful valleys running through it. The hills are made of{limestone}and contain fossils. A good time to find these is in winter when the land has been ploughed. Most of the fossils are of sea urchins and are known locally as "Shepherd's Crowns", "Sheep's Hearts" and "Potato Fish". There are also flints in the{limestone and in the last century these were napped and used by builders. The Church and many of the cottages are built of flint and bricks. There is a{clay}capping to the hill tops which was forced to the surface{ during the Cretaceous Period leaving hillsides of newly formed chalk. The clay was used to make bricks, which were fired locally and have become a feature of the local barns.
